original: Åsander, Per Albert Sigvard, civil-inigenjör, Göteborg, f. 21/11/04 i Sundsvall. G. 41 m. Gertrud Huth. — Utex. fr. Örebro tekn. gymn. 24, avg:ex. v. KTH (E) 29, skepparex. 2:a kl. 34. Anst. v. Skönviks Kraftv. i Sundsvall 24-26, Skönviks Gellulosafabr. i Ort-viken, Sundsvall, 26, ASEA i Västerås 29, Graham Brothers dottibol., A-B Elevator i Ulriksdal 30, chef f. Graham Brothers A-B el. avd. där 36, konsult, o. besiktn :ing. f. hissar, lyft-inrättn. o. el. anläggn. v. Mell. o. Norra Sv:es Angpanneförendngs elekt-rotekn. avd. i Gbg 42. Led. av Sv. tekn :fören. fr. 29.
translated: Åsander, Per Albert Sigvard, civil engineer, Gothenburg, born on 21/11/04 in Sundsvall. Married in 1941 to Gertrud Huth. Graduated from Örebro Technical Gymnasium in 1924, completed his degree at KTH (E) in 1929, obtained a 2nd class ship captain's exam in 1934. Employed at Skönviks Power Plant in Sundsvall from 1924-1926, Skönviks Cellulose Factory in Ort-viken, Sundsvall in 1926, ASEA in Västerås in 1929, Graham Brothers daughter company, A-B Elevator in Ulriksdal in 1930. Became head of the Graham Brothers A-B electrical department in 1936, consultant and inspector of elevators, lifting devices, and electrical installations at the Central and Northern Sweden Steam Boiler Association's electrical department in Gothenburg from 1942. Member of the Swedish Technical Society since 1929.

employmentHistory.name: Central and Northern Sweden Steam Boiler Association
